New Records: Virat Kohli scored his 50th ODI century, breaking Sachin Tendulkar's record of 49 ODI hundreds
Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips and Kane Williamson led New Zealand's fightback with a 181-run partnership
Mohammed Shami took seven wickets to dismiss New Zealand
Daryl Mitchell scored a hard-fought century for New Zealand
India set a target of 398 runs, which they defended by 70 runs
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed pride in the team's performance and the historic achievement
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the team on reaching the final
Sachin Tendulkar praised Mohammed Shami for his performance
Former England captain highlighted the strength of the current Indian side
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shubman Gill scored 80 runs despite being forced to limp off due to cramps
Rachin Ravindra fell to Mohammed Shami for 100 runs in 10 overs
The match was played at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai
